report_metadata.title: REPORTED IMPACT SNAPSHOT | GAZA STRIP
report_metadata.disclaimer: Figures that are yet-to-be verified by the UN are attributed to their source. [cite: 2]

fatalities_in_israel.context: This includes fatalities on 7 October and the immediate aftermath, including foreign nationals [cite: 41]

hostages.source: According to Israeli media citing official sources [cite: 40]

geospatial_information.israeli_militarized_zone: 86.3% of the Gaza Strip are within the Israeli-militarized zone, under displacement orders or where these overlap [cite: 58]

food_security.statistic: 81% of households reported poor food consumption in July, up from 33% in April [cite: 66]
24% of households are experiencing very severe hunger in July, compared with 4% in April [cite: 66]
Nearly 9 out of 10 households resorted to extremely severe coping mechanisms to feed themselves [cite: 66]
100% of the analysed population (2.1 million) is projected to face high levels of acute food insecurity (IPC Phase 3 or above) [cite: 67]
breakdown: One million people facing emergency levels of food insecurity (IPC Phase 4) [cite: 69]
470K people facing catastrophic levels of food insecurity (IPC Phase 5) [cite: 70]

food_security.statistic: 83% of agricultural water wells and 71% of greenhouses damaged [cite: 71]
86% of the permanent crop fields damaged [cite: 71]
food_security.source: UNOSAT and FAO analysis, as of 28 July 2025 [cite: 71]

food_security.statistic: 1.5% of cropland area is available for cultivation [cite: 71]

food_security.source: Food Security Sector, as of December 2024 [cite: 71]

health.source: Health Cluster as of 9 August 2025, unless otherwise noted [cite: 76]
data: 50% (18 out of 36) of hospitals partially functional [cite: 73]
62% (10 out of 16) of field hospitals partially functional [cite: 74]
39% (66 out of 170) of primary health care centres functional [cite: 75]
32 Emergency Medical Teams (EMTs) deployed by 20 international and two national organizations as of 3 August [cite: 75]
Over 14,800 patients require medical evacuation abroad [cite: 76]
Between 1 February and 6 August 2025, 2,116 patients and 3,305 companions have been evacuated outside Gaza [cite: 76]
436,000 housing units (92%) are destroyed (160,000) or damaged (276,000) [cite: 78]
~1.35 million people are in need of emergency shelter items [cite: 79]
around 1.4 million people are estimated to require essential household items [cite: 79]

protection.statistic: >1 million children in need of mental health and psycho-social support [cite: 82]
62% of people don't have access to legal documents proving property ownership [cite: 83]

organizational_breakdown: 356 UN staff (UNRWA: 350, WHO: 1, UNDP: 2, UNOPS: 2, UNDSS: 1) [cite: 86]
53 PRCS staff and volunteers (29 while on duty) [cite: 87]

fatalities.health_workers: 1,580 killed (some also counted as aid workers) [cite: 89]

data.statistic: 92% of children aged 6-23 months and pregnant and breastfeeding women are not meeting their nutrient requirements due to lack of minimum dietary diversity [cite: 92]
290,000 children under five and 150,000 pregnant and breastfeeding women require feeding and micronutrient supplements [cite: 93]
~17,000 pregnant and breastfeeding women are estimated to require treatment for acute malnutrition between April 2025 and March 2026 [cite: 94]
data.source: IPC Gaza Strip Special Snapshot, 12 May 2025 [cite: 94]

data.statistic: ~71,000 cases of acute malnutrition among children aged 6 to 59 months, including 14,100 severe cases, are expected to occur between April 2025 and March 2026 [cite: 95]
data.source: IPC Gaza Strip Special Snapshot, 12 May 2025 [cite: 95]

data: 81% (567 out of 696) of public WASH facilities and assets are within the Israeli-militarized zone or under displacement orders since 18 March [cite: 98]
96% of households have experienced water insecurity and 90% of key informants reported worsening levels of drinking water security in July 2025 [cite: 99]
89% of the WASH sector assets have been either destroyed or partially damaged [cite: 100]
>658,000 school-aged children and 87,000 tertiary students are left without access to formal learning spaces [cite: 103]
16,613 school students and 731 educational staff killed [cite: 104]
Nearly 91.8% of schools (518 out of 564) will require full reconstruction or major rehabilitation to be functional again [cite: 106]
>2,308 educational facilities, ranging from kindergartens to universities, have been destroyed [cite: 108]

reported_infrastructure_damage.statistic: 78% of all structures are destroyed or damaged [cite: 123]
88% of the 48,987 assessed entities in the commerce and industry sector in Gaza have been damaged or destroyed (22% damaged and 66% destroyed) [cite: 123]
81% of the classified road network (primary, secondary, and tertiary roads) and 62% of the total road network have been damaged or destroyed [cite: 125]

definitions.facilitated: CLA accepts a facilitation request and the movement on the ground is not impeded. [cite: 138]
definitions.impeded: CLA accepts a facilitation request but the movement is blocked or delayed on the ground, resulting in some missions being aborted or accomplished partially. [cite: 137]
definitions.denied: The Israeli Coordination and Liaison Administration (CLA) rejects a facilitation request. [cite: 135]
definitions.withdrawn: Humanitarian organizations cancel their facilitation request due to logistical, operational or security reasons. [cite: 134]
